data.text: Are ok imho pros: you can fit a large handlebar box on it (tight but works), it increases the distance to the seat which gives a rest from upright position, it can be wrapped twice/trice to make it really thick comfy if you have large hands., you can cut some of both ends to bring shifters, levers a little away from stem./// cons: heavier than straight handlebars with integrated horns (just one piece of pipe which makes it no longer straight). it no gets at any point the Jones bar position (as the former straight bar does). , The large size is 48 cm wide about (the former straight bar is wider), you can fit a mirror only with dedicated belt (while in others you can expand/secure the holder with a screw inside the pipe. ---btw the Jones is not suitable to attach a handlebar box (which can gets heavy) due to the huge distance from the box to the Fork`s upper pipe. it can stress the stem and breakdown in a downhill and damage a tree as result. üò≠. the Bike in the back has a straight handlebar with integrated horns (only one piece of pipe).
